definition: to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: It was illegal according to the Persian Law.
sentences.chinese: 根據波斯法律，這是不合法的，要被殺頭的。

sentences.english: I heard the Queen say only yesterday you deserved to be beheaded.
sentences.chinese: 就在昨天，我聽見王后說，你是應該殺頭的。

sentences.english: You're about to be killed for using the government's money, you know.
sentences.chinese: 你很快就要因盜用公款罪而被殺頭了，知道嗎？

sentences.english: They would decapitate their enemies and keep them as talismans .
sentences.chinese: 他們將自己的敵人殺頭，留得住作爲護身符。

sentences.english: You might both have been caught and killed.
sentences.chinese: 你倆都可能被捕和殺頭。

sentences.english: That would mean the king had failed to perform his function and off went his head (regicide).
sentences.chinese: 那就意味着國王在他的智能上表現得失敗，會被殺頭。

sentences.english: Jiang Jie would rather be killed than betray the party secret .
sentences.chinese: 江姐寧可殺頭，也不出賣黨的機密。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
